Greek Chicken Souvlaki Bowl

Prep: 20 min Cook: 35 min Servings: 2
greek chicken healthy

Ingredients

For the Chicken Meatballs

For the Roasted Potatoes

For the Greek Salad

For the Tzatziki

Instructions

Preparation

  1. Preheat oven to 200°C.
  2. Start potatoes: Toss potato cubes (400g) with olive oil (2 tbsp), oregano (1 tsp), and salt. Spread on one side of a large baking sheet. Put in oven.

Make the Tzatziki

  1. Grate cucumber (1/4 cucumber) and squeeze out all water using a kitchen towel.
  2. Mix yogurt (200g) with tzatziki spice mix (1 tsp), taste, add more if desired.
  3. Stir in squeezed cucumber and olive oil (1 tbsp). Refrigerate until serving.

Prepare and Cook the Meatballs

  1. Mix ground chicken (400g) with garlic (2 cloves), oregano (1 tsp), cumin (1/2 tsp), salt, pepper, and lemon juice (2 tbsp).
  2. Form into 8-10 meatballs. Drizzle with olive oil (1 tbsp).
  3. After 15 minutes: Add meatballs to the baking sheet with potatoes.
  4. Bake together for 15-20 minutes more, turning meatballs once. Potatoes should be golden (30-35 mins total), meatballs cooked through (74°C internal).

Make the Greek Salad and Assemble

  1. While everything bakes: Combine tomatoes (2), cucumber (1/2), feta cubes (100g), olives (50g), and onion (1/4).
  2. Drizzle with olive oil (2 tbsp) and lemon if using. Add fresh herbs.
  3. Assembly: Divide roasted potatoes between bowls. Add Greek salad and meatballs. Top with generous tzatziki and extra fresh herbs.

Notes

Tips:

  • For crispier potatoes: start at 220°C, reduce to 200°C when adding meatballs
  • The tzatziki spice mix already contains salt, so taste before adding more
  • Save any extra tzatziki for tomorrow - it keeps 2-3 days
